title: MVP-ORAM: a Wait-free Concurrent ORAM for Confidential BFT Storage

key_metrics.processing_capacity: hundreds of 4KB accesses per second in modern clouds
key_metrics.fault_tolerance: Byzantine fault tolerant, no trusted proxies required
key_metrics.concurrency: Wait-free protocol supporting concurrent fail-prone clients

kms_applicability: Critical for multi-region key storage with Byzantine fault tolerance. Addresses RTO impact by enabling fast concurrent access to encrypted key material.

title: GeoShield: Byzantine Fault Detection and Recovery for Geo-Distributed Real-Time Cyber-Physical Systems

key_metrics.fault_detection: Byzantine fault-resilient network measurement for geo-distributed systems
key_metrics.attack_resistance: Proactive detection of malicious message delays across regions
key_metrics.recovery: Bounded-time recovery without relying on trusted hardware

kms_applicability: Directly addresses multi-region KMS coordination with proactive fault detection. Measures network resilience across geographically distributed key management servers.

title: Private Virtual Tree Networks for Secure Multi-Tenant Environments Based on the VIRGO Overlay Network

key_metrics.pki_model: Scalable overlay without global PKI requirements
key_metrics.authorization: Cryptographically enforced membership through signed delegation certificates
key_metrics.multi_tenancy: Hierarchical organization mirroring real organizational structures

kms_applicability: Enables vendor-agnostic multi-cloud key distribution across regions. Comparable to HashiCorp Vault concepts but with decentralized PKI approach.

title: QLink: Quantum-Safe Bridge Architecture for Blockchain Interoperability

key_metrics.crypto_agility: First interoperability framework combining PQC + QKD + HSM
key_metrics.quantum_safety: Information-theoretic security against quantum and classical adversaries

kms_applicability: Addresses crypto-agility across cloud providers with quantum-resistant encryption. Integrates quantum key distribution for future-proof key management.

title: Methods and Tools for Secure Quantum Clouds with a specific Case Study on Homomorphic Encryption

key_metrics.pqc_implementation: Integration of post-quantum cryptographic algorithms into cloud frameworks
key_metrics.privacy_preserving: Homomorphic encryption for computation on encrypted data
key_metrics.algorithm_options: QOTP, Chen, GSW algorithms with performance trade-offs

kms_applicability: Future-proofs KMS with quantum-resistant and privacy-preserving encryption. Implements HE for encrypted key operations without decryption.

title: Quantum-Resistant Cryptographic Models for Next-Gen Cybersecurity

key_metrics.pqc_landscape: Lattice-based, code-based, multivariate polynomial, hash-based cryptography

kms_applicability: Enables crypto-agility for multi-cloud environments with quantum threats. Hybrid model supports gradual migration without breaking existing systems.

title: TriHaRd: Higher Resilience for TEE Trusted Time

key_metrics.clock_resilience: Byzantine-resilient clock updates for distributed TEE systems
key_metrics.attack_mitigation: Resistance to clock speed and offset manipulations
key_metrics.trusted_hardware: Leverages TEE for secure time without global synchronization

kms_applicability: Ensures synchronized key operations across geographically distributed regions. Critical for key rotation and expiration coordination in multi-region KMS.

title: D2M: A Decentralized, Privacy-Preserving, Incentive-Compatible Data Marketplace for Collaborative Learning

key_metrics.decentralization: Blockchain smart contracts for escrow and audit

kms_applicability: Decentralized KMS coordination across multiple cloud providers with Byzantine resilience. Smart contracts manage key escrow and dispute resolution.

title: Sedna: Sharding transactions in multiple concurrent proposer blockchains

key_metrics.privacy: Until-decode privacy guarantees reducing MEV exposure
key_metrics.bandwidth: Approaches information-theoretic lower bound for overhead

kms_applicability: Reduces bandwidth overhead in multi-region key sharing protocols. Verifiable rateless coding enables efficient key distribution across multiple cloud providers.

title: DNA-HHE: Dual-mode Near-network Accelerator for Hybrid Homomorphic Encryption on the Edge

key_metrics.algorithm_flexibility: Dual-mode support for RNS-CKKS and Rubato cipher
key_metrics.resource_efficiency: DSP-efficient modular reduction with parallel scheduling

kms_applicability: Enables efficient homomorphic encryption for key operations at cloud edges. Supports flexible algorithm switching for different threat models and performance requirements.
